Comments_List: Practical skills on using OpenMP, MPI, and CUDA, in addition to optimizing C code for machine architecture.

The final project was a highlight of the course.  While it is good that the instructor responded to student questions in class, students asking questions really slowed down the course and so it would have been nice to move faster and cover more content.

This is a good course to learn the fundamentals of parallel programming and gain some practical skills in applying them.  A motivated student with sufficient background could probably cover the course content in a couple weeks of independent study.
